title: Build in US, not India, or pay tariffs: Trump’s ultimatum to Apple
content: Donald Trump warned Apple that if it builds factories in India, the company will face tariffs when selling its products in the United States. Trump threatened a 25 per cent tariff on smartphones made outside the US, extending the warning to other manufacturers like Samsung. He said his expectation that iPhones sold in America should be manufactured domestically.

title: Rahul Gandhi visits J&K's Poonch, meets families affected by Pakistan shelling
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited Poonch in Jammu and Kashmir to meet families affected by recent cross-border shelling from Pakistan. The unprovoked firing has severely impacted the Poonch and Rajouri districts, damaging homes and disrupting lives. Chief minister Omar Abdullah welcomed the visit, appreciating political leaders reaching out to those affected.

title: Explained: Why Rajat Patidar faced a heavier fine than Pat Cummins
content: Rajat Patidar and Pat Cummins faced fines for slow over-rates during their IPL match, with Patidar incurring a heavier penalty of Rs 24 lakh due to RCB's repeat offence. Cummins was fined Rs 12 lakh for SRH's first violation. The match saw SRH defeat RCB by 42 runs, as the IPL emphasizes over-rate penalties to maintain the pace of play.

title: 3 childhood friends die in high-speed SUV crash on Bhopal-Indore highway
content: In a tragic incident on the Bhopal-Indore Highway, three childhood friends, Pankaj Sisodia, Preet Ahuja, and Vishal Dabi, lost their lives when their speeding SUV crashed into a tree and electric pole. Rahul Kanade, the fourth friend, is critically injured and receiving treatment.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: 'No credentials to speak about protecting civilians': India rips into Pakistan at UN
content: India strongly criticized Pakistan at the UN Security Council for its hypocritical stance on civilian protection, citing Pakistan's support for terrorists and recent attacks on Indian civilians and religious sites. India highlighted Operation Sindoor, launched in response to a terror attack, and accused Pakistan of cross-border shelling that severely damaged border communities in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: 'India will never give in to nuclear blackmail, will engage Pak bilaterally': Jaishankar
content: During his Berlin visit, external affairs minister Jaishankar firmly condemned the Pahalgam terror attack, asserting India's zero-tolerance stance on terrorism and its resolve against nuclear blackmail. He emphasised that all issues with Pakistan would be handled bilaterally, excluding third-party involvement. Discussions with German leaders focused on strengthening the India-Germany partnership, with Germany expressing support for India's right to self-defense.

title: Actor Mukul Dev passes away at 54
content: Actor Mukul Dev, recognized for his diverse roles in television, Bollywood, and regional cinema, has tragically died at the age of 54. News was confirmed by close friend Deepshikha Nagpal on social media. The cause of death is currently undetermined, as friends gathered to pay their respects. Dev's last appearance was in the Hindi film 'Anth The End.'

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: Delhi man learns of wife's affair, conspires with her to kill lover
content: In Delhi, a 24-year-old businessman from Bihar, Arun Mehto, was murdered due to an illicit affair. Police arrested a couple after discovering the wife's relationship with Mehto. The husband, upon learning of the affair, coerced his wife to lure Mehto to a secluded area where he fatally struck him with an iron rod, disposing of the body in Maidan Garhi.

title: Karnataka: 4 back in jail after rape suspects get heroes’ welcome following bail
content: Seven men, accused in a 2024 gang-rape case, were released on bail after 17 months and celebrated their return with a large vehicle procession, sparking public outrage. Videos showed them waving and their supporters cheering, leading to re-arrests for bail violations and an ongoing investigation. The incident, initially reported as moral policing, involved a 26-year-old woman who identified the accused.

title: Not just Apple, Trump has bad news for all phone companies with his 'June' deadline
content: President Trump threatened a 25% tariff on all smartphones sold in the US but manufactured elsewhere, impacting companies like Apple and Samsung. This move aims to push smartphone production to the United States, despite experts deeming it unrealistic and potentially raising iPhone costs significantly. Trump expressed his dissatisfaction with Apple's manufacturing in India, insisting on domestic production to avoid tariffs.

title: RCB's top-2 finish in IPL 2025 is still alive - but only if this happens
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru squandered a golden opportunity to seal a top-two finish in the IPL 2025 standings, falling to a 42-run defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad on Friday. Chasing a daunting 232-run target—powered by Ishan Kishan’s scintillating unbeaten 94 off 48 balls—RCB needed a precise and aggressive approach with the bat.

title: 'Will not discuss … ': US tells WTO that India has no basis to impose duties
content: The US has informed the WTO that it sees no basis for India's proposal to suspend concessions in response to American tariffs on steel and aluminium. India had proposed retaliatory duties on 29 American products, claiming the US tariffs would affect $7.6 billion in imports.

title: Pappu Lohara, top Maoist leader, among 2 killed in Jharkhand encounter
content: In Jharkhand's Latehar district, security forces neutralized two key leaders of the Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad, a splinter Maoist group, during an operation on Saturday. Pappu Lohara, carrying a Rs 10 lakh reward, and Prabhat Ganjhu, with a Rs 5 lakh bounty, were killed in the encounter.

title: 23 Covid cases in 10 days; no reason to panic: Delhi govt
content: Delhi's health minister reported 23 Covid-19 cases detected by private labs, prompting an urgent investigation to determine if they involve residents or travelers. While symptoms are mild, the government is prepared and coordinating with hospitals.

title: Nature's silent assassin: The deadly mushroom at the heart of Australia’s murder trial
content: An Australian woman, Erin Patterson, faces murder charges after a lunch she prepared allegedly resulted in three deaths and one near-fatal illness. The victims, her in-laws and an aunt and uncle, consumed a beef Wellington containing death cap mushrooms. Prosecutors suspect foul play, citing Patterson's alleged fake cancer claim, selective eating during the meal, and suspicious cleanup afterward.

title: 'Will not be silenced by terrorism': Tharoor's strong message as he departs for US
content: Shashi Tharoor leads a parliamentary delegation to the US, aiming to share India's experiences with terrorism and explain its current strategies. The team, including MPs from various parties and former ambassador Taranjit Singh Sandhu, will also visit Guyana, Panama, Brazil, and Colombia. Their mission is to present a united front against terrorism and seek global partnerships for peace and security.

title: Happy brother's day 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share
content: Brother's Day 2025 is the perfect occasion to celebrate the unique bond shared with brothers, those built-in best friends who have been partners-in-crime and unwavering supporters. The article provides a collection of heartfelt and humorous messages, quotes, and social media captions to express appreciation for the brother who has been a constant presence through life's adventures.

title: After Harvard, will US stop other universities from enrolling foreign students? What Trump said
content: President Trump criticized Harvard University, saying they "have to change its ways" after the DHS threatened to remove their ability to enroll foreign students. He questioned the university's academic standards, particularly a remedial math course. However, a federal judge blocked the Trump administration's action, with Harvard claiming it was retaliation and unconstitutional, potentially affecting over 7,000 visa holders.

title: I'm managing my workload as much as possible: Mohammed Shami
content: Mohammed Shami is working on his fitness for the upcoming Test series in England. He acknowledges the need to increase his workload after the IPL. Shami feels his and Bumrah's presence is important for leading the bowling attack. He is not satisfied with his IPL performance.

title: RBI's record Rs 2.7 tn dividend fueled by USD sell offs & forex gains: SBI
content: The Reserve Bank of India's record dividend payout to the government, nearly Rs 2.7 trillion, was primarily driven by substantial dollar sales and foreign exchange gains. The RBI actively intervened in the forex market, becoming a major seller of reserves. Increased earnings from rupee securities also contributed, although tempered by falling G-sec yields.

title: 'Shubman Gill is someone who reads the game and communicates well'
content: Shubman Gill is set to succeed Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain, despite mixed leadership numbers. Teammates and coaches praise his calm demeanor, game understanding, and communication skills. Gujarat Titans, led by Gill, currently top the IPL table, but their middle-order vulnerabilities were exposed in a recent loss, highlighting the team's reliance on its top order.

title: 'It's good to lose': RCB skipper after defeat against SRH
content: Despite a 42-run defeat against Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH), stand-in skipper Jitesh Sharma sees it as a valuable learning experience for Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). He acknowledged the team's rustiness and lack of initial intensity, but believes the loss provides an opportunity to analyze and improve before the IPL 2025 playoffs.

title: Velvet, yellow diamonds, and a saucer hat: Janhvi Kapoor’s at Cannes 2025
content: Janhvi Kapoor captivated at Cannes with a sleek, all-black ensemble, a departure from her previous shimmery pink look. Styled by her cousin Rhea Kapoor, the outfit paid homage to Yves Saint Laurent, featuring a vintage saucer hat and velvet jacket. A custom-made silk chiffon skirt by Anamika Khanna and exquisite yellow diamonds by Chopard completed the iconic, Hollywood-esque appearance.

title: Neeraj Chopra finishes 2nd in Poland with final-round effort - Watch
content: Neeraj Chopra secured second place at the Janusz Kusocinski Memorial in Poland, battling tough weather conditions to achieve an 84.14m throw in his final attempt. Julian Weber of Germany outperformed Chopra with an 86.12m throw, while Anderson Peters of Grenada finished third. Chopra will now concentrate on upcoming competitions in Paris and Ostrava.

title: RCB suffer first away defeat of IPL 2025 season
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad defeated Royal Challengers Bengaluru by 42 runs, marking RCB's first away loss in IPL 2025. Ishan Kishan's explosive 94 propelled SRH to 231/6. Despite a strong start from Salt and Kohli, RCB's chase faltered, leading to a collapse and a final score of 189. Cummins and Malinga starred with the ball, securing a morale-boosting victory for SRH.

title: Paresh Rawal returns Rs 11 lakh to Akshay Kumar's production house: Report
content: Paresh Rawal has officially stepped away from 'Hera Pheri 3', sparking widespread discussion about his unexpected departure. New reports indicate that the actor has returned his signing amount to the film’s producers and has officially concluded his involvement in the anticipated sequel.

title: 'What's the point ... ': Why Bangladesh interim chief Yunus is threatening to resign
content: Muhammad Yunus, the interim head of Bangladesh, is reportedly considering resigning due to political deadlock and pressure from various factions. He faces criticism for delaying elections, a warning from the army chief, and accusations of undermining freedoms from Human Rights Watch. According to reports, Yunus said in the meeting with his advisers, "what is the point of being the chief advisor if he cannot function properly?”

title: ‘No one undermined democracy in Pak like this’: EAM on hypocrisy of West
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has criticised the West for its support of military regimes in Pakistan, asserting that this backing has significantly undermined democracy in the country. He highlighted Europe's focus on its own energy needs, questioning the expectation that other nations should suffer due to Europe's actions regarding Russian oil.

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Knicks' season is in jeopardy
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: Pacers hail Siakam as 39-point night quiets MSG
content: Behind Pascal Siakam's 39-point performance, the Pacers will head home with a 2-0 series lead after hanging on for a 114-109 win over the Knicks in Game 2 on Friday night.

title: Knicks frustrated as lapses on D cost them again
content: The Knicks had costly defensive breakdowns for the second straight game in Friday night's Game 2 and acknowledged they have to "figure it out" as the series heads to Indiana for Game 3.

title: MVP SGA, runner-up Jokic headline All-NBA teams
content: The five players who finished atop the MVP balloting, including winner Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and runner-up Nikola Jokic, highlighted the All-NBA teams.

title: 'Yes, we can play defense': Oilers blank Stars in G2
content: Stuart Skinner made 25 saves for his third shutout of the postseason and the Oilers beat the Stars 3-0 in Game 2 on Friday night to even the Western Conference finals.

title: Braves' Acuña homers on 1st pitch after year away
content: Ronald Acuña Jr. crushed his first pitch 467 feet for a home run in his dramatic return to the Braves on Friday night, almost one year after he tore his left ACL.

title: Skenes on trade chatter: 'Anybody can play GM'
content: Paul Skenes didn't hear Pirates GM Ben Cherington say that trading him to give the club an influx of position player talent is "not at all part of the conversation." When someone relayed Cherington's comments to him, the 22-year-old ace laughed.

title: Red Sox slam O's 19-5 behind Devers' 8 RBIs
content: Rafael Devers had a career-high eight RBIs, hitting a three-run homer in the sixth inning and a grand slam in a 13-run eighth, to lead the Boston Red Sox over the Baltimore Orioles 19-5 on Friday in a day-night doubleheader opener.

title: Green Bay files NCAA waiver to play in $1M TBT
content: Green Bay filed for a waiver from the NCAA to allow its men's basketball team to compete in The Basketball Tournament, the $1 million, winner-take-all summer tournament.

title: ⚾ Best player of a generation: Betts or Trout?
content: Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Which NBA Finals matchup is most compelling? We're ranking all four possible series
content: No matter which two teams escape the conference finals, we're headed for a never-before-seen Finals matchup.

title: Napoli edge out Inter to win 4th Serie A title
content: Napoli clinched their second Serie A title in three seasons after edging Inter Milan thanks to a 2-0 home victory over Cagliari in a dramatic finale to the season on Friday.

title: Klopp on booing TAA: So upset I turned off TV
content: Jurgen Kopp has expressed his disappointment with Liverpool fans booing Trent Alexander-Arnold after the defender announced he will leave the club this summer.

title: Napoli hero McTominay wins Serie A MVP award
content: Scott McTominay proved there's plenty of life after Manchester United, after ending his first season since leaving Old Trafford with a Serie A title and the league's MVP award.

title: Inter focus on UCL 'dream' as Serie A slips away
content: As Inter Milan came to terms with losing the Serie A title on the final day, the tea's assistant coach said they must now shift focus to the Champions League final against PSG

title: Ancelotti after Madrid exit sealed: Bond is 'eternal'
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave Real Madrid after this weekend's final game of the LaLiga season, the club has confirmed.

title: Sources: Garnacho set for Man Utd transfer talks
content: Alejandro Garnacho is increasingly likely to leave Manchester United this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: NWSL's DeMelo reveals she has hyperthyroidism
content: Savannah DeMelo was diagnosed with Graves' disease and hyperthyroidism last fall, conditions she spoke about publicly for the first time this week with ESPN.

title: Ronaldo sells stake in Valladolid following protests
content: Brazil great Ronaldo is selling his controlling stake in Valladolid, the Spanish soccer club said on Friday.

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Man United boss Ruben Amorim and whether he'll remain as manager following a Europa League final loss. So let's make the arguments for keeping him or making a clean break.

title: The 12 most impactful NBA draft withdrawal decisions for college basketball
content: Milos Uzan, Alex Condon and other college hoops stars whose NBA draft decisions could materially shape 2025-26.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Kevin De Bruyne close to Napoli move after Man City exit
content: Napoli are reportedly close to signing Man City midfielder Kevin De Bruyne. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Norris finds peace, not pressure, in F1 title expectations
content: While the weight of expectation to win F1's title can crush some, Lando Norris is using it as motivation.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: Two pro football seasons in one year? The 'unheard of' pursuit of some NFL hopefuls
content: NFL dreams have come true for UFL players, but it can come with the price of the longest season of a player's life.

title: Wanted For Fraud, Indian National Angad Chandhok Deported From US To India
content: A US court convicted Angad Chandhok in 2022 for being part of an international tech support scam that defrauded citizens.

title: "Pawns, Poker Chips": Foreign Students At Harvard Panic Amid Trump Battle
content: The Trump administration has accused Harvard of maintaining an unsafe campus culture that gives unfair treatment to Jewish people.

title: Man, Sleeping Under Tree, Buried Alive As Workers Dump Sludge On Him In UP
content: The victim, who was allegedly in a drunken state, was resting under the shade of a tree near his house when the incident took place.

title: Germany Sends Permanent Troops To Another Country For First Time Since WWII
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visited Lithuania this week to inaugurate Berlin's brigade to help protect the eastern flank of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).

title: Building Collapses After Fire At Factory Triggers Blast In Delhi
content: Thick black smoke was seen billowing from the multi-storey building, which collapsed after an explosion, as the flames rapidly engulfed the entire structure.

title: After Apple, Samsung Faces 25% Trump Tariff Threat. There Could Be More
content: President Donald Trump said that the tariffs he threatened against Apple Inc earlier Friday would also be aimed at a wider range of device makers, including Samsung Electronics Co, to spur them into moving manufacturing of their products to the US.

title: Elias Rodriguez, Who Killed Israeli Embassy Staff, Has History Of Political Activism
content: Elias Rodriguez told the police that he was inspired by a US airman, who set himself ablaze outside the Israeli Embassy in Washington, DC last year.

title: Doubt Cast On Claim Of 'Hints' Of Life On Faraway Planet
content: Several recent studies have found that there is not enough evidence to support astronomers' claims of the most promising hints of alien life yet on a distant planet.

title: "Germany Recognises Our Right To Defend Against Terrorism": S Jaishankar
content: S Jaishankar's remarks highlight India's firm stance on counterterrorism and the strong international support it has received.

title: Long Advantageous, Harvard's China Ties Become A Political Liability
content: Harvard University's links to China, long an asset to the school, have become a liability as the Trump administration levels accusations that its campus is plagued by Beijing-backed influence operations.

title: 2 Army Majors, Extramarital Affair And Court's "Burden Of Fidelity" Remark
content: Upholding the right to privacy in an alleged extramarital affair case involving two senior Army officers, a Delhi court has rejected a request seeking CCTV footage from a hotel.

title: PM Modi To Chair NITI Aayog Meet Today With Chief Ministers Of Several States
content: The Governing Council, the apex decision-making body of NITI Aayog, includes all Chief Ministers, Lieutenant Governors of UTs, and several Union Ministers.

title: MBBS Student Drugged, Gang-Raped In Maharashtra, Classmates Among 3 Arrested
content: A third-year MBBS student was allegedly raped in Maharashtra's Sangli district by her two classmates and one of their friends after they spiked her drink, police said on Friday.

title: After Two Setbacks, SpaceX Could Try To Launch Massive Starship Next Week
content: SpaceX said it will make another launch attempt next week of the massive Starship rocket -- key to CEO Elon Musk's long-term vision of colonizing Mars -- after two consecutive in-flight explosions earlier this year.

title: Maoist With Rs 10 Lakh Bounty Killed In Jharkhand, Days After Top Leader's Encounter
content: Pappu Lohara, who was carrying a reward of Rs 10 lakh,was the leader of the Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad, a renegade Maoist outfit.

title: 2016 Jewel Thieves Who Stole Kim Kardashian's $4 Million Ring Convicted
content: A French court convicted the jewel thieves who in 2016 tied up US reality TV star Kim Kardashian at gun point before making off with her $4 million engagement ring and other booty.

title: Nagpur Man Arrested For Sexually Assaulting A Horse At Riding Academy
content: The official said CCTV footage revealed the accused, Chotya Sundar Khobragade, allegedly sexually assaulting one of the horses.

title: Auschwitz Museum Warns Against Fake AI Images Of Victims
content: The Auschwitz museum warned against Facebook posts with "harmful" AI-generated fictional images of victims of the Nazi German death camp, condemning them for "falsifying history".

title: China Pledges Support For Overseas Students After Trump's Harvard Curb
content: China will safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of its overseas students and scholars, the foreign ministry said.

title: After Shootings, Washington's Shaken Jewish Community Looks To Bolster Security
content: The fatal shooting of the young couple after an event at a Jewish museum has deeply shaken the US capital's Jews, and has led to a review of security protocols at synagogues and other institutions.

title: Experts weigh in: How will Djokovic and Swiatek fare? Can Alcaraz defend?
content: Alcaraz and Swiatek were last year's French Open champs, but Sinner, Gauff and many more could contend.

title: Drills, arms test planned over Andamans, airspace closed
content: Subhro Niyogi is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, and his job responsibilities include reporting, editing and coordination of news and news features. His hobbies include photography, driving and reading. title: Delhi HC reserves order on Celebi's security clearance withdrawal

title: News wrap: EAM says Pahalgam attack meant to create fear, Trump targets Harvard; & more
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Can the NWSL withstand the allure of Europe?
content: the national women's soccer league is the most talent-rich, competitively balanced and exciting in the world . the league is stacked with many of the world's best players -- from the united states and Brazil, to Spain and France, to Malawi and Zambia . it's the English Premier League of women' s soccer -- the best of the global best .

title: How Jim Irsay prepared his daughters to succeed him as Colts owners
content: Jim Irsay grew up in privilege, with his father amassing a big enough fortune to acquire the Baltimore Colts in 1972 . but his involvement with the franchise did not originate in the boardroom . he often told stories about picking up players' jockstraps while cleaning the locker room .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .

title: Oilers make a statement with 3-0 win in Game 2: Grades, takeaways for both teams
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Dallas Stars 3-0 to tie the series at 1-1 . Stuart Skinner was the most boom-or-bust player in the postseason . he gave up 20 goals and didn't have a save percentage better than .833 in four losses .

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: Liverpool's 'Miracle of Istanbul' through the eyes of Benitez, Garcia and the fans
content: Rafael Benitez's side sit 3-0 down to AC Milan in the UEFA champions league final . the imposing atatürk Olympic Stadium was not the most conventional setting for a miracle . it was a contest that Liverpool had no right to win .

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .

title: Rains LIVE: Southwest Monsoon sets over Kerala a week before the normal date, announces IMD
content: This is the earliest date of monsoon onset over Kerala after the year 2009 when it was set in over Kerala on 23rd May 2009

title: Kuvempu University postpones exam after BA students receive wrong question paper
content: The Registrar (Evaluation) blames the chairperson of the board of examiners for the development. He would issue a notice to the erring official seeking explanation, the officer said.

title: Banks cannot withhold no dues certificate for non-discharge of another loan obtained in a different capacity, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy also holds that the Banking Ombudsman cannot file counter affidavits before courts of law defending the decisions taken by the banks

title: Bangladesh cancels $21 million contract with Kolkata based defence PSU GRSE
content: A press statement by the GRSE said that the cancellation was on expected lines this order though would not have impact on GRSE’s finances.

title: All-party delegation reaches Bahrain to highlight ‘India’s stand against cross-border terrorism’
content: Indian delegation in Bahrain highlights stand against cross-border terrorism as part of global diplomatic outreach

title: Mr. India, Mr. South India titles can be used in bodybuilding competitions, says Madras High Court
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says such titles would not, in any manner, violate Section 3 of the Emblems and Names (Prevention of Misuse) Act of 1950

title: ISF MLA Nawsad Siddique writes to Jadavpur University authorities against ragging of Muslim student
content: This is one of the multiple ragging incidents that have come to light in one of Kolkata’s most premium institutes

title: Webinar on ‘Raising a Healthy Child’ to be held on May 25
content: The webinar will offer valuable guidance and actionable tips on promoting child health and well-being at every stage of growth

title: Assam BJP prepares groundwork for 2026 polls
content: The party resolves to maintain the winning streak in the upcoming elections, including those for the Bodoland Territorial Council and the Silchar Municipal Corporation

title: Donated ₹25 lakh to National Herald, says Karnataka deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar
content: “Me and D.K. Suresh donated ₹25 lakh each to National Herald. What is wrong in that. We have donated to a newspaper run by our party. What’s wrong in that,” Mr. Shivakumar said

title: Madras High Court permits Gillette to take possession of imported dental floss consignment without registering it as a medical device
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says the notification requiring registration was only in the draft stage and it had been issued only after the import

title: Planting for elephants: Green step in degraded Assam forest on Bhutan border
content: A biodiversity conservation group undertakes a mission to replenish 100 hectares of a degraded patch in the Bhairabkunda Reserve Forest

title: Arambai Tenggol flag hoisted on Manipur’s Shirui peak, Nagas angry
content: The apex body of the Tangkhul community said it was a disgraceful attempt to tarnish the spirit and meaning of the Shirui Lily Festival

title: Two Maoists, including JJMP supremo Pappu Lohra, killed by security forces in Jharkhand
content: Lohra was carrying the reward of ₹10 lakh whereas another maoist who was killed Prabhat Ganju carried the reward of ₹5 lakh.

title: Archaeologist Amarnath Ramakrishna refuses to revise findings on Keezhadi excavations
content: Further examination of the sequence contradicts the well-reasoned, conclusive findings of the Keezhadi site, says archaeologist Amarnath Ramakrishna

title: Pakistan violated spirit of Indus Waters Treaty by inflicting three wars, thousands of terror attacks: India tells U.N.
content: “We are constrained to respond to the disinformation being carried out by the delegation of Pakistan with regard to the Indus Waters Treaty. India has always acted in a responsible manner as an upper riparian state,” India’s Permanent Representative to U.N. Ambassador Parvathaneni Harish said

title: We will not be silenced by terrorism, don't want the world to look away, says Congress MP Shashi Tharoor
content: Tharoor highlighted that the delegation will bring to attention the values India stands for which have to be preserved in the world today

title: IMD declares red alert for seven districts in Kerala
content: IMD sounds a red alert for the Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Kottayam, Alappuzha, Thrissur, Idukki, and Malappuram districts.

title: Calcutta High Court bars coercive police action against protesting teachers in West Bengal
content: The Court also asked protestors to limit their attendance to 200 at a time, and shift their protest site from outside the State Education Department office.

title: Police shoot murder accused in leg after he attacks them during arrest in Salem
content: The accused, identified as Naresh Kumar (26), a resident of Kattikaranoor village in Omalur block, has over 20 robbery cases registered against him at various police stations across the district.

title: A taste of Kerala in Hyderabad: stores that bring home closer
content: Over 80 Kerala stores dot Hyderabad, selling the quintessential Kerala products to a community five lakh strong. For Malayalis, they are more than a place to buy groceries, for in the din of the big city, these shops offer them moments of home, connecting them with traditions and bringing back memories

title: Fickle weather ravaging Telangana’s traditional mango varieties
content: Delayed winter and unseasonal rains are upsetting the cultivation of traditional mango varieties in Telangana—once one of the biggest experimental sites for mangoes—making the fruit less remunerative for farmers

title: Army officer assault case: Prime duty of police not to instil fear, says Punjab and Haryana High Court, dismisses anticipatory bail of accused police official
content: Inspector Ronnie Singh, who was among others suspended and booked under cognisable and non-bailable sections including 109, 310, 115(2), 117(1), 117(2), 126(2), 351(2) and 190 of Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) in the case had approached the High Court for anticipatory bail

title: MEPMA to tie up with NGOs to groom women entrepreneurs in Andhra Pradesh
content: Plans are afoot to create 30,000 women entrepreneurs across 123 municipalities; meeting held to identify organisations with foreign funding and CSR initiatives

title: Supreme Court spares jail term for convict in POCSO case, cites systemic failures
content: The case arose from a 2018 incident in West Bengal, where a 14-year-old girl left her home to live with a 25-year-old man, who later fathered her child.

title: BSF jawan detained by Pakistan a month ago returns home to a hero’s welcome
content: The jawan’s house in Hooghly’s Rishra town was decked up for a grand welcome while the neighbourhood was full of banners and posters extolling his bravery.

title: Left parties demand judicial probe into deaths of Maoists in Chhattisgarh encounter
content: They demand that Operation Kagar be withdrawn immediately and the bodies of the deceased be handed over to their families

title: Home Ministry sanctions honorary rank to retiring CAPF personnel
content: Constables, head constables, assistant sub-inspectors and sub-inspectors will be accorded the next senior rank without additional pensionary benefits

title: CM Naidu urges Centre to notify Amaravati as the capital
content: On the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh, the Central government should notify Amaravati as the capital of Andhra Pradesh under the AP Reorganisation Act, 2014, he said.

title: Research scholars upset over DST’s delay in release of stipends
content: Many INSPIRE-Fellowship scholars say they have not received funds from the Science Ministry’s DST for nearly a year; DST Secretary acknowledges disbursement crisis and says that all scholars will get their money on time from June

title: Jyoti Rani: The vlogger who is being called a spy
content: Jyoti Rani, a 34-year-old YouTube vlogger from Haryana, has been arrested by the Hisar Police on charges of espionage. Her alleged closeness to officials of the Pakistan High Commission and sponsored visits to the neighbouring country have raised suspicion among Indian officials, but the police say there is no evidence yet of her having shared secret details with Pakistani intelligence officials. Ashok Kumar reports on the case

title: Russia reiterates commitment to uncompromising fight with India against terrorism
content: The statement came after the all-party parliamentary delegation arrived late to Moscow, due to Ukrainian drone attacks, in a diplomatic bid to reiterate the Indian position on terrorism.

title: 71% Indians experienced severe heatwave in last 12 months: study
content: The Yale Program on Climate Change Communication and CVoter surveyed 10,751 Indians and found that most of them had personally experienced at least one extreme weather event in the past 12 months.

title: Zero tolerance for terrorism, India will never give in to nuclear blackmail: Jaishankar in Germany
content: The German foreign minister publicly condemned the terrorist attack on India, and supported India's right to defend itself against terrorism

title: Low sodium salt substitutes yet to take off in city
content: Low sodium salt substitutes are alternatives to regular table salt which is high in sodium content; the survey says that 52% of supermarkets and hypermarkets stock the substitutes, whereas only 4% of local grocery shops have them

title: Ceasefire with India is holding, we are fully committed to it: Pakistan Foreign Office
content: Shafqat Ali Khan also said that the two militaries have a channel of communication through the Directors General of Military Operations, through which they are working for de-escalation

title: Kerala woman’s journey to the peak of Mount Everest
content: She scaled the 8,849-foot-high peak on May 18. As part of the training, she climbed Mt Kilimanjaro in Tanzania,  Mt Aconcagua in Argentina, Mt Elbrus in Russia along with her husband.

title: TG and A.P. resolve to strengthen inter-state cooperation in civil supplies sector
content: Telangana would gain critical infrastructure such as corporation flats and storage facilities, while Andhra would facilitate rice exports through Kakinada Port, opening up international markets including the Philippines

title: Caste census a ‘moral obligation’ of Indian democracy: Kharge
content: Congress chief urges party spokespersons to take the message of social justice to the grassroots in view of the upcoming caste census; need to make data public and then rebuild policies, he says

title: Naidu requests Centre to set up defence projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: Andhra Pradesh has proposed a missile and ammunition production centre in Jaggayyapeta–Dolakonda cluster, a centre for military and civil aircraft and electronics manufacturing in Lepakshi–Madakasira cluster, says the Chief Minister

title: Removed from ration card without consent, woman finally wins battle
content: The names of the woman and her children were removed from the ration card upon her husband’s request to transfer the ownership of the card to him

title: Supreme Court rules that CAPF officers to be ‘organised services’ for all purposes
content: The top court orders for IPS deputation to CAPFs in senior ranks to be reduced progressively within two years

title: Lepakshi and APCO sign MoU to improve market visibility of  handloom and handicraft products
content: The collaboration outlines measures such as consignment-based exchanges, allocation of showroom space for displays and implementation of strategic logistics and pricing measures

title: The Hindu’s campaigns receive prestigious INMA Global Media Awards
content: Campaign marking city’s anniversary secured two first places, two second places, and a third; The Hindu also shared a top global win, while The Hindu Young World initiative was lauded.

title: Progress report indicates Kerala government’s resolve to go ahead with SilverLine project
content: Report states the government’s intention to launch the land acquisition process for the ₹60,000-crore project after environmental impact studies and securing the necessary clearances

title: Young Lieutenant Shashank Tiwari dies saving fellow soldier in Sikkim
content: Army officials said that the officer was leading a Route Opening Patrol towards a Tactical Operating Base in Sikkim — a key post being prepared for future deployment

title: 4 Maoists with ₹18 lakh bounty killed in Maharashtra’s Gadchiroli
content: The encounter took place along the Maharastra-Chhattisgarh border barely 25 km from the site where 27 Maoists were killed in an encounter two days ago; in another encounter in Sukma district, a Maoist operative was killed by the security forces

title: India extends airspace ban for Pakistan airlines till June 23
content: The ban set up in the wake of the Pahalgam attack was set to expire on May 23; Pakistan has also extended the ban on its airspace for Indian flights by a month till June 24

title: Shelling in J&K not random, Pakistan picked its targets: Trinamool
content: Five-member TMC delegation concluded their two-day visit to J&K, with the Rajya Sabha TMC leader Derek O’Brien asserting that the Pakistani strikes were not random but aimed at specific civilian areas.

title: Delhi court issues notice to Nirmala Sitharaman in defamation case by Somnath Bharti’s wife
content: The complainant had alleged that, during the Lok Sabha polls in 2024, the Minister had published defamatory, derogatory and libellous remarks in print and electronic media against her and the same were broadcasted in two TV channels

title: Yoga events to be held at tourist spots in NTR district to spread awareness
content: 2,500 yoga masters will hold sessions at village, mandal and division levels every day up to June 21, says Collector

title: Greater Chennai Corporation plans to improve 346 roads in 14 zones for ₹92.74 crore
content: The works is split into 21 packages to upgrade interior and bus route roads, cement concrete, bituminous tar, and interlocking pavers

title: Pangkang villagers sign MoU for Siang upper project amid local dissent
content: State hails pact as milestone in cooperative development; ₹5 crore package announced for project-affected families

title: BMTC to introduce new NICE road route from Tavarekere to Electronics City
content: The new route will connect Tavarekere to Electronic City via Kadabagere Cross, Gollarahatti, and the NICE Road, catering especially to daily office-goers and industrial area employees.

title: Ujjain police questions vlogger Jyoti Rani over Mahakaleshwar visit
content: Visit to temple city under scrutiny following arrest on espionage charges; nothing suspicious found, say officials

title: No more ‘Pak’ in Mysore Pak: Jaipur shops rename sweets to reflect ‘popular sentiments’
content: From Mysore Pak to Swarna Bhasma Pak, many popular sweets get a new name, thanks to local people claiming the term ‘Pak’ reminded them of Pakistan

title: Officials at fault for flooding in Bengaluru, say Karnataka Lokayukta
content: A committee led by BBMP Commissioner M. Maheshwar Rao has been formed to come up with ‘a holistic solution’

title: Madras High Court holds former Coimbatore Collector, DRO and  RDO guilty of contempt
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs them to pay a fine of ₹10,000 each from their salaries besides sentencing four Tahsildars and one VAO to one month simple imprisonment

title: Exhibit availability of ombudsman at offices of local bodies in prominent manner, says the Madurai Bench
content:
The Tamil Nadu Local Bodies Ombudsman Act was enacted to address complaints against the elected members of the local bodies, and also officers and employees, Justice B. 
Pugalendhi says, refusing to interfere with an order passed by the Ombudsman against a former municipal commissioner

title: Election Commission to provide mobile phone deposit facilities for voters outside polling stations
content: The mobile phones shall be allowed within 100 meters of the polling station, and that too in switched-off mode. No mobile phones shall be allowed to be carried inside the polling station by the voter, the the poll panel said in a statement.

title: HC orders action under Wildlife Protection Act against people dumping, burning waste at Sabarimala
content: Directive follows death of two elephants and a deer after consuming plastic waste dumped on the temple premises

title: Ailing wild elephant dies without responding to treatment near Coimbatore
